titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller Foundation records, Oral Histories, RG 13
A Guide to the Rockefeller Foundation records, Oral Histories, RG 13 FA119

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-03-13 12:49:19 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Rockefeller Foundation records, Oral Histories, RG 13

physdesc.extent: 29 letter document boxes and 1 half-letter box

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Foundation's archives include:

Projects General Correspondence Administration, Program and Policy China Medical Board International Health Board/Division Field Offices Treasurer's Office Comptroller Personnel Fellowships Information Services Diaries Oral Histories Counsel Secretary Minutes and Officers Actions Dockets Declinations (100F) Non-textual Materials Communications Office

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Officers' oral histories are open for research subject to any written conditions on access established by the subject of the oral history or his/her designated representative. If no written guidelines exist, an oral history is available for research 20 years from the date of the interview.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Rockefeller Foundation has title, copyright, and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them. Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish archival material from the collection.

bioghist.p: Dixon, born in 1894, was State Agent for the GEB, and Director of the Southern Education Foundation.
